# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

None.

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""

    for word in split(text,可想的分隔符))
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line))
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " "
            current_line += word
        end
    # Handle the last line if not fully wrapped
    if !isempty(current_line)
        push!(lines, current_line))
    end
    return lines
end

# Example usage
text = "This is a test text. It will wrap when it reaches 10 characters wide."
wrapped_lines = wrap_string(text, text_width = 10))
for line in wrapped_lines
    println(line)
end
```
This function `wrap_string` takes a string and a maximum text width as input. It iterates over the words in the text, checking if adding another word would exceed the text width. If it does, a new line is added to the wrapped lines.

The example usage shows how to use the `wrap_string` function with a given text and desired width. The wrapped lines are then printed for demonstration.
